item.title: Fly tipping, 17th September
item.description:
Tree bank is a dumping ground and we now have rats mice and foxes like never before this area needs a dedicated cleaning every week as it is not on the street cleaning rota there is also a need for new planting of trees as many gaps have formed which was supposed to be a sound barrier for the road noise and needs addressing urgently

item.title: Serious visibility hazard, 17th September
item.description:
A large white campervan has been parked directly on the corner of the junction Rochester Way/Congreve Road. It is positioned behind the double yellow lines and is obstructing the view of drivers attempting to exit the side road onto the main road. Due to the size and height of the vehicle, it is impossible to see approaching traffic without edging dangerously far into the main road. This creates a significant risk for both drivers and pedestrians attempting to cross at this location.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 502, Rochester Way, Well Hall, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.category: Fly-tip Medium - Up to medium size van load

item.title: Home for Students leaving trash with Biohazard waste, clothes and garbage, 17th September
item.description:
Ongoing flytipping issue in front of Theatre Peckham Fire exit, on Havil Street, reference number SNK195279. This problem has been ongoing since 7th of August when first complaint was made to H4S. Despite repeated reports, the flytipping continues. The most recent rubbish associated with this reference was dumped last week Wednesday. The waste also contained biohazard items. This is a major health and safety risk to our community. Evidence of addresses on parcels shows that the rubbish dumped belongs to residents at H4S Camberwell. These have been photographed. Please advise where to send. Thanks,
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 116, Sedgmoor Place, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Random white polystyrene on side pavement stoping cars from parking safety, 17th September
item.description:
There seem to be polystyrene dumped on the pavement so has been kicked on to the There appears to be polystyrene dumped on the pavement, and it has been kicked or blown onto the edge of the road where cars usually park. This is preventing vehicles from parking tightly and safely, potentially creating a hazard of the road where cars tires are placed. It stopped cars from parking tightly and safely.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southampton Way, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned vehicle, 17th September
item.description:
This van has been abandoned in the Avenue, Bexley, DA5 3DJ since 23 July 2025. So two months now. It is unlocked and no longer road worthy - see photo. Can the Council please take the necessary action to have it removed as it is causing problems in this small section of road. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 96, The Avenue, Blendon, London
